content.question:
Directions: The suggested time for answering this question is about 22 minutes. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

According to atmospheric temperature and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration records derived from Antarctic ice cores, Earth’s climate has undergone significant changes over the past 200,000 years. Two graphs are shown below. The upper graph shows the variation in atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration, and the lower graph shows the variation in air temperature. Both graphs cover the same time period from approximately 200,000 years ago up until the year 1950, which is represented as year 0 on the graphs.

Answer the following questions that relate to the graphs above. Remember that for any calculations you must clearly indicate how you arrived at your answer. Answers must also include appropriate units.

Determine the net change in atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration between 140,000 years ago and 125,000 years ago.

Calculate the ratio of the change in mean global temperature to the change in atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration between 140,000 years ago and 125,000 years ago.

Scientists predict that between 1950 and 2050, the atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration will increase by 200 ppm. Predict the change in mean global temperature between 1950 and 2050 using the ratio that you calculated in part (ii).

Describe one major assumption that was necessary to make the prediction in part (iii) above. Discuss the validity of the assumption.

Identify and describe TWO major causes for the predicted 200 ppm increase in atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentration between 1950 and 2050.

Identify TWO gases other than <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> that contribute to the anthropogenic increase in mean global temperature. For each gas, describe a major human activity that leads to its release.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
